articles.author: MPX
articles.title: WaPo: Trump made 1,419 in 7 weeks leading up to midterms
articles.description: The Washington Post Fact Checker is reporting that "in the seven weeks leading up the midterm elections, the President made 1,419 false or misleading claims, an average of 30 a day."

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: November surprise: Trump’s own lawyer exposes his 'racist language'
articles.description: President Trump’s former fixer Michael Cohen details “repeatedly racist” language used by Trump, even while running for President in 2016. Michael Cohen’s friend, Donny Deutsch, says he knows “for a fact” that Cohen was inspired to speak out at this moment be…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Watch journalist get Scaramucci to admit Trump growing the deficit
articles.description: With just four days before the midterm elections, voters must assess President Trump’s achievements so far. Former White House Communications Director, Anthony Scaramucci notes Trump’s economic deregulation agenda, but says Republicans raising the deficit aft…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: GOP to target pre-existing conditions, safety nets if they retain House
articles.description: According to the New York Times, “Republicans would claim a conservative mandate to cut taxes, chip away at the Affordable Care Act and shrink federal spending” if they retain the House of Representatives in the midterms.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: 2018 Early voting ballots exceed 2014 count
articles.description: According to the NBC News Data Analytics Lab -- using voter data provided by Target Smart --  roughly 29 million Americans have already voted. That number exceeds the total early vote in the 2014 midterm election by more than 8 million.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Politico: GOP fears Trump’s immigration obsession could backfire
articles.description: According to a Republican campaign official: "Trump is solidifying swing voters who were already leaning Democratic and are now definitely going vote for Democratic candidates."

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Rachel Maddow presents Bag Man, an MSNBC podcast
articles.description: Subscribe now through your preferred podcast service or via MSNBC.com/bagman for the new MSNBC podcast from Rachel Maddow, BagMan.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Mucarsel-Powell: 'Willing to talk to anyone who will expand access to Medicare'
articles.description: Florida Democratic House candidate Debbie Mucarsel-Powell sits down with Chuck to discuss her campaign.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Why is Russia suspiciously silent during the US midterms?
articles.description: Former CIA & Pentagon chief of staff Jeremy Bash, MSNBC analyst Elise Jordan, AP’s Jonathan Lemire,  Boston Herald’s Kimberly Atkins, and Axios’ Jonathan Swan on concern over Russia looming over the midterm elections

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: ‘All in on nationalism’: Trump’s closing message a deal breaker for GOP voters?
articles.description: AP’s Jonathan Lemire, Boston Herald’s Kimberly Atkins, Axios’ Jonathan Swan, Rev. Al Sharpton & Vanity Fair’s Emily Jane Fox on Trump’s continued message of fear-mongering & racist dog whistles  with four days to go before the midterm elections

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Taking on Trump’s lies & fear-mongering, Obama delivers closing argument for Gillum
articles.description: MSNBC analyst Elise Jordan, Boston Herald’s Kimberly Atkins, Axios’ Jonathan Swan and AP’s Jonathan Lemire on former President Obama’s return to the campaign trail for Andrew Gillum and Bill Nelson in Florida

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Down but not out: Beto rides wave of momentum & early voting surge
articles.description: NBC’s Garrett Haake, MSNBC analyst Elise Jordan, Boston Herald’s Kimberly Atkins, Axios’ Jonathan Swan and AP’s Jonathan Lemire on the tightening senate race in Texas

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Steve King denounced by his own party, rebukes comparisons to synagogue shooter
articles.description: Steve King (R-Iowa) comes under fire in the last days of the 2018 midterm elections.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Cardenas: 'Big gap' between Trump rhetoric and what candidates...
articles.description: Former Chair of Florida Republicans Al Cardenas sits down with Chuck to discuss to discuss how Latinos are engaging in Florida's midterm elections.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Ain't no sunshine when Congress won't let Florida have it's way
articles.description: Tonight, Chuck's obsessed with the Florida bill that would put the state in Daylight saving time all year round.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Friday's Mini-Report, 11.2.18
articles.description: Today's edition of quick hits.
articles.content: Today’s edition of quick hits: * An unfortunate step backwards : The White House announced Friday it is re-imposing economic and trade sanctions on Iran, starting at midnight on Sunday. The move is intended to change the country’s politics through economic pr… [+2539 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Vanity Fair report: Michael Cohen claims President Trump used racist language
articles.description: Vanity Fair reporter Emily Jane Fox joins Deadline White House to talk about Michael Cohen's claim that President Trump repeatedly used racist language.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: How national politics are playing into the Tennessee senate race
articles.description: Kasie Hunt speaks with Tennessee Democrat senate candidate Phil Bredesen about the tribal nature of politics in 2018.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: What’s at play in Georgia politics?
articles.description: Katy speaks with local political experts in Atlanta, Georgia ahead of former President Barack Obama’s visit to discuss some of the major issues playing into the midterm elections including voter suppression.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: The Big Question: In 2018 who inspires more voters, Obama or Trump?
articles.description: As Election Day approaches, President Donald Trump is on the campaign trail stumping for Republican candidates, while former President Barack Obama is rallying for Democrats in Florida and Georgia. Which President has more sway over voters?

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Ex-CIA analyst hopes for win in district Trump narrowly won
articles.description: Elissa Slotkin is hoping to turn a Michigan U.S. House seat blue in a congressional district President Donald Trump won by a razor thin margin in 2016.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Watergate Docs: 'Road map for how Constitution, rule of law works'
articles.description: Academy Award winner Charles Ferguson, director of the new documentary “Watergate”, and Liz Holtzman, former House Judiciary Committee member who voted to impeach President Nixon, join Ali Velshi to talk about the timely release of secret grand jury documents.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: The best political ads of 2018
articles.description: Chuck and the NBC News Political Unit go through some of the best ads from this election cycle, from the most viral to the most surprising.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Judge rules against Kemp over voters misidentified as non-citizens
articles.description: A federal judge on Friday ordered that new U.S. citizens must be allowed to vote if they can show proof of citizenship at the polls.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: #RoadWarriors: Trailing in Trump Country
articles.description: Watch as Morgan Radford talks with voters in a part of Pennsylvania often labeled "Trump Country" about what matters to them ahead of the midterm elections.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Why You Vote: Native Americans still struggle with voting rights
articles.description: In 4 days, Americans can go vote and be heard – but this right is not applied equally across the country. Ali Velshi and Stephanie Ruhle are joined by journalist Jenni Monet to discuss how current rules in North Dakota are keeping some indigenous people from …

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Does your state allow you to take time off to vote?
articles.description: In four days, the nation gets a say in how the government is run – but how do you vote if you’re working? Watch Ali Velshi and Stephanie Ruhle break down how your employer might be required to give you time off to exercise that right.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: What does each party need to win on Election Day?
articles.description: Midterm elections are just days away. Stephanie Ruhle and Ali Velshi are joined by Steve Kornacki to break down what both parties need in the fight for the House, Senate, and Governor’s seats nationwide.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Meet the African-American women running for office in TN
articles.description: In Shelby County, Tennessee – home to Memphis – there is a record breaking number of African-American female candidates running for office. Ali Velshi and Stephanie Ruhle are joined by NBC News Correspondent Trymaine Lee to discuss how many of these women are…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: #MonumentalAmerican: Native American who pushed for voting rights
articles.description: As Native Americans struggle to vote due to state laws, Stephanie Ruhle and Ali Velshi recognize Miguel Trujillo. Trujillo was a Native American veteran and a key figure in winning voting rights in New Mexico. He is a #MonumentalAmerican.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Strong jobs report could boost GOP in final days before midterms
articles.description: The #1 issue for a majority of Americans is their money and the future of their finances. Today, the government released a strong jobs report and Ali Velshi and Stephanie Ruhle break down how this could be a boost for Republicans in these final days before th…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Connie Britton joins Andrea to discuss voting initiative with Michelle Obama
articles.description: Andrea Mitchell sits down with actress Connie Britton, who has joined former First Lady Michelle Obama's "When We All Vote" initiative.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Did the White House get caught in a lie about the FBI HQ project?
articles.description: We're talking about a controversy that points to possible presidential corruption, which now appears to involve multiple officials who haven't told the truth.
articles.content: Trump, GSA head caught putting Trump business ahead of taxpayers As regular readers know, Donald Trump’s keen interest in the FBI’s headquarters has been at the center of an ongoing controversy. Axios reported in July, for example, that there’s been a debate … [+4223 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Washington Post CEO on Jamal Khashoggi
articles.description: Washington Post CEO and Publisher Fred Ryan speaks at the 2018 Courage in Journalism Awards about contributor Jamal Khashoggi.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Rehema Ellis talks to volunteers working to maximize African American voter turnout in Mississippi
articles.description: Democratic organizers are hoping they can replicate what happened in Alabama last year to get another win in a deep red state. Road warrior Rehema Ellis is in Jackson, Mississippi to tell us their game plan.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Trump redefines electability, and it's not all bad, says editor
articles.description: The Beat DC's Tiffany Cross explains why Trump's redefining of what electability means isn't necessarily bad for new candidates appealing to younger voters or people of color.

articles.title: Friday's Campaign Round-Up, 11.2.18
articles.description: Today's installment of campaign-related news items from across the country.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: What will Trump's rhetoric mean for next week?
articles.description: The Morning Joe panel discusses President Trump's tone and rhetoric ahead of the midterms and the impact his omnipresence could have on congressional races.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: New Time magazine cover challenges the U.S. to move 'beyond hate'
articles.description: A powerful new issue of Time magazine explores how we can move past the hate we saw displayed in violence last week. One of the authors, Princeton professor Eddie Glaude, joins Stephanie Ruhle to discuss what it will take for the country to move forward with …

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Despite his dubious record, Trump says, 'When I can, I tell the truth'
articles.description: Trump seemed to acknowledge a certain realization that he's not seen as honest. The president could've simply said, "I always tell the truth," but he didn't.
articles.content: In an interview this week, Donald Trump described his social-media messages as my form of telling the truth. The phrasing was odd: the president didn’t say his missives are true, but rather his form of what true. He said something similar two days later. Pres… [+2484 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trump administration reimposes Iran sanctions lifted in 2015 nuclear deal
articles.description: The sanctions cover Iran's shipping, financial and energy sectors. They're the second batch of penalties reimposed since President Donald Trump withdrew from the deal in May.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: 250,000 jobs added in the U.S. in October and wages rise
articles.description: After the release of another strong jobs report, Stephanie Ruhle and Politico Chief Economic Correspondent Ben White break down the new numbers.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: What to expect from close upcoming midterm races
articles.description: As we head into the final weekend before the election, some incumbent candidates are just barely holding onto their seats. Real Clear Politics Associate Editor A.B. Stoddard and New York Times Opinion Columnist Bret Stephens join Stephanie Ruhle to discuss wh…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: GOP once aspired to something better, says strategist
articles.description: Republican consultant Stuart Stevens laments the nationalist tone of the Trump White House, saying that Republicans in previous years aspired to something better than what is there now.

articles.title: White House's John Bolton complains about...
articles.description: If the current rules have allowed Trump-level corruption to fester, weakening those rules would be a spectacular mistake.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Millennials running for office in record numbers
articles.description: There are a record number of millennials running for office across the country in the hope of bringing new leadership and bridging the partisan divide in the U.S.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Colorado voters weigh in on the midterms
articles.description: MSNBC's Jacob Soboroff travels to Colorado ahead of the midterms to get a sense of what's on voters minds and what inspires them to vote.

articles.title: Following synagogue and pipe bomb attacks, Trump finds the wrong victim
articles.description: As Donald Trump reminded us last night, the president seems to enjoy feeling sorry for himself.
articles.content: Last week, as Americans were confronted with news of a Donald Trump fan targeting Democratic officials with pipe bombs, the president complained that this Bomb stuff was interfering with the Republican Party’s election messaging and the GOP’s purported moment… [+2648 chars]

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: U.S. economy adds 250,000 jobs in October
articles.description: The U.S. economy added 250,000 jobs during the month of October, better than economists forecasted as the unemployment rate held steady at 3.7 percent.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Trump picks a curious adjective to describe Georgia's Stacey Abrams
articles.description: According to the Trump Twitter Archive, Trump has called exactly one person "unqualified" since becoming president, and it's Stacey Abrams.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Tom Brokaw, Marc Morial weigh in on midterms
articles.description: Rep. Steve King, R-Iowa, reacted strongly to questions about his affiliation with far-right groups and figures during a candidate forum in Des Moines. Tom Brokaw and Marc Morial discuss King as well as other midterm races.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Job market bounces back in final pre-election report
articles.description: Ahead of this morning's jobs report, most projections pointed to job growth in September around 188,000. The initial data suggests we did even better than that.
articles.content: Ahead of this morning’s jobs report, most projections pointed to monthly job growth in September around 188,000. The initial data suggests we did even better than that. The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported this morning that the economy added 250,000 jobs i… [+1680 chars]

articles.title: Beto still down but gets closer to Cruz in new polling

articles.title: In racist video, Trump can't even try to scare people without lying
articles.description: Trump's notorious new ad isn't just based on racism; it's also based on demonstrable lies. The video suggests he has a degree of contempt for his own base.

articles.title: Trump 'whines' about treatment amid synagogue tragedy
articles.description: The president's embrace of nationalism could prove a bridge too far in the midterms for 'educated, wealthier whites -- especially women,' according to New York Times reporting. Also, Trump laments about how Pittsburgh changed the midterm conversation.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Joe: Trump's caravan closing arguments will not work
articles.description: Rather than stay on the sidelines in the final push to the midterms, President Trump is taking center stage by holding rallies and making announcements about immigration and troops at the border. Will this strategy help the GOP cross the finish line?

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Voter I.D. law contradicts reality of Native American life in ND
articles.description: Tim Purdon, former U.S. attorney representing the Spirit Lake Tribe in challenging North Dakota's new voter ID law, talks with Rachel Maddow about how the new I.D. demands threaten the voting rights of Native Americans in that state.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: U.S. military assessment of caravan doesn't match Trump's panic
articles.description: Rachel Maddow points out that according to leaked assessment documents published by Newsweek, the U.S. military does not see the kind of threat that would warrant Donald Trump's pre-election panic deployment of 15,000 troops to the border.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Documents expose Trump border deployment as political stunt
articles.description: James LaPorta, investigative reporter for Newsweek, talks with Rachel Maddow about U.S. military assessment documents leaked to him that show a stark contrast with the racist panic Donald Trump is trying to whip up ahead of the 2018 election.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Some GOP candidates stranded by Trump's low-road 2018 strategy
articles.description: Rachel Maddow looks at how Donald Trump's strategy of pushing extreme racist and xenophobic fear-mongering in the last days of the 2018 campaign season is hurting some of his party's candidates who were already struggling against records of attacking Obamacar…

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: 2018 a case in point for the value of every single vote
articles.description: Rachel Maddow reviews the remarkable number of races in the 2018 election that are currently polling at a dead heat tie.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trump's impact on suburban voters in the midterm elections
articles.description: What will be the Trump effect on the suburban counties where Hillary Clinton won in 2016, but Republicans were able to hold on to their jobs? Steve Kornacki walks us through the numbers.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trump stokes fear, tells troops to shoot if migrants throw rocks
articles.description: The president continues to used more & more heated rhetoric when talking about the migrant caravan slowly headed toward the U.S.-Mexico border. Our panel reacts to his latest comments.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Oprah knocks on doors for Democrat Stacey Abrams in Georgia
articles.description: A tight race for governor in Georgia got a famous face knocking on doors. Will Oprah be the difference in the race between Democrat Stacey Abrams and Republican Brian Kemp? Our panel reacts.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Was Roger Stone a Wikileaks messenger to Trump's campaign?
articles.description: The New York Times breaks news with emails between Roger Stone & Steve Bannon. An exchange that the Mueller team is already well aware of. Our panel reacts.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Lawrence: How Democrats are fighting against a president who won't tell the truth
articles.description: President Trump has ramped up his false statements in the final days of the midterm elections. Lawrence says the key to Democrats campaigning successfully against Trump is to campaign on the issues and not take on Trump and his divisive rhetoric. John Heilema…

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: A wave of African American women elected in Tennessee
articles.description: All In Correspondent Trymaine Lee talks to 8 of the 20 women who've already won in races in Shelby County this year.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: GOP Rep. Steve King blows up at constituent
articles.description: The white nationalist Iowa Republican took issue with being asked about the similarities between his ideology and that of the Pittsburgh synagogue shooter.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Gillum: Trump & my opponent DeSantis "seem to be twins"
articles.description: The president and Ron DeSantis "seem to be twins at dividing, at stoking the politics of fear," says Democratic candidate for governor of Florida Andrew Gillum.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Matthews: Trump promotes fear, not solutions, on immigration
articles.description: 5 years ago, the Senate passed an immigration bill with bipartisan support. The House refused to take it up. Why can't Trump close the deal? Chris says it's because he prefers the issue and the fear it creates as opposed to a solution.
